Title: Retailer clarifies RTX 5090 'B-stock' listing with missing ROPs was a system error
Description:
German tech retailer Alternate has explained a controversial recent listing on its website for an RTX 5090 with missing ROPs. On the site it was classified as "B-stock" that, despite the apparent defect, was being sold for more than the graphic card model's MSRP. The online store confirmed has now that this GPU was part of a customer return and was never intended for sale (via ComputerBase).

The first case of an RTX 50 series GPU with missing ROP units dates back to late February, with many subsequent reports to follow as awareness increased. ROPs are hardware units on your GPU responsible for pixel processing, blending, anti-aliasing, and writing to the frame buffer. All displayed pixel data must go through the ROP units before it can be written to the GPU's memory.

Nvidia later issued a clarification asserting only 0.5% of produced RTX 5090s and RTX 5070 Tis were impacted, asking affected customers to push their respective board partners for a replacement. After it was revealed that this manufacturing defect extended to the RTX 5080 as well, testing by Gamer's Nexus showed that GPUs with a missing ROP cluster take an up to 11% performance hit while gaming.

Considering the broad Blackwell shortage, retailers selling defective units with missing ROPs at a discount wouldn't be surprising. Last week, Alternate listed a "B-stock" RTX 5090 with 168 (out of 176 advertised) ROPs for €2,899 ($3,100), a price that's comparable to fully functional models. After the news emerged, the German store contacted ComputerBase, explaining that the listed GPU was the consequence of an internal system error and was never intended to be sold.

B-stock typically refers to products that are no longer considered new due to issues like cosmetic flaws or customer returns. Based on the extent of these issues, retailers then establish a reasonable price tag for these items. The defective RTX 5090 at Alternative was likely misclassified as B-stock in their database due to a part defect: the missing ROP units. Moreover, the system defaulted to the cost of a brand-new RTX 5090, as it was probably not designed to price GPUs with missing ROPs in the first place.

“We have of course removed the said graphics card from the sale... Some internal processes run automatically where errors can happen.” Alternate to ComputerBase

The GPU has now been delisted from the website, and it was apparently a customer return, likely intended for replacement. Blackwell supply is gradually improving but the same cannot be said for the prices.

Even though street prices barely adhere to the MSRP, AIBs are continuing to increase them as we move into April. The average selling price of an RTX 5090 Founders Edition at eBay has stabilized at $4,000 but we're still likely months away from normality. Sadly, this trend continues to plague both current-gen and last-gen GPUs, not just from Nvidia, but from all three vendors.

Title: Asus drops teaser for Xbox 'Kennan' handheld — reveals sneak peek days before Switch 2 launch
Description:
Rumors about an Xbox handheld have been flying around, and Asus just fanned the flames by dropping a teaser on its X (formerly Twitter) account.

The video shows an animated robot programming improvements on a terminal for itself. Just as it was about to implement the changes, a device that looks like an ROG Ally X gaming console and an ROG Raikiri Pro controller fell in with the character. After the dust settles, the robot apparently turns into a gaming console that looks vaguely similar to the company’s current top-end handheld.

What made this social media posting even more interesting was that the official Xbox account replied with the side-eye meme. Nothing official has been announced yet, by any means, but Microsoft’s response likely refers to Project Kennan — the gaming handheld it’s developing with Asus that’s designed to unify Xbox and Windows as one platform.

While neither party has revealed anything specific, the video gave us a preview of what to expect from this planned Xbox handheld. This includes a longer battery life, better performance, and bigger storage, alongside a new look for this handheld.

Asus posted the video on March 31, 2025, at 2 pm EST. The company likely did this to avoid the teaser from being misconstrued as an April Fool’s prank, especially as many other tech companies are posting jokes of their own. However, just like its April 1 ROG Ally reveal a couple of years ago, it seems that this teased Xbox console is legit.

(Image credit: ROG Global)

Another thing we should note is that the much-anticipated Switch 2 is set to be announced at Nintendo Direct on April 2. This Asus reveal could therefore be an attempt to steal Nintendo’s thunder — and while it did not have much information, it likely caused a stir among PC gamers and handheld gaming enthusiasts. It still probably won’t sway hardcore Nintendo enthusiasts, though.

We’re not expecting a new Xbox console until 2027, but the arrival of an 'Xbox handheld' will certainly be most welcome. We just hope that this will run Xbox games natively, and not just be a Windows 11 device with an Xbox skin on top of it.

Title: Snapdragon X exclusive Copilot+ features begin trickling through to modern x86 Windows 11 PCs
Description:
Microsoft has announced that several Windows 11 Copilot+ AI features are graduating from Snapdragon X exclusivity to AMD Ryzen AI 300 series and Intel Core Ultra 200V PCs. On Monday it began its expanded roll-out of features like Live Captions, Cocreator, Restyle Image, and Image Creator – so they will be available on modern AMD and Intel systems, as well as PCs packing Qualcomm Snapdragon X (SDX) series processors.

Live Captions will also translate from 27 languages into Simplified Chinese (Image credit: Microsoft)

One of the most welcome additions to Windows 11 for those embraced by the expanded Copilot+ feature compatibility is probably Live Captions. Microsoft says that this feature “offers real-time translations in English for audio and video content during virtual meetings, podcasts, or video playback.” This feature, which Microsoft claims can live translate from 40 languages to English, has been around a while for SDX PCs, and is “coming soon” for those with a Ryzen AI 300 or Ultra 200V PC.

Another new Copilot+ addition which Microsoft characterizes as an accessibility feature is rolling out to Qualcomm SDX machines soon. Voice Access delivers better descriptive and flexible language interaction with Windows. AMD and Intel system owners with NPUs will have to wait until “later this year” for this one, though.

Cocreator in Paint is now ready for modern AMD and Intel processor owners. Here, Microsoft’s AI can help you create imagery from prompts or analyzing and improving on your badly drawn scrawl.

(Image credit: Microsoft)

With Copilot+ smarts introduced to Microsoft’s Photos app, Windows 11 users with the requisite AMD and Intel chips get two ‘AI’ features to play with. Restyle Image is an AI-driven photo-filter style feature which can make existing works look something like an oil painting, sketch, or so on. Image Creator does what it says from your simple, or complex, text prompts.

Give your idle NPU something to do (Image credit: Future)

Microsoft says to make sure you switch on ‘Get the latest updates as soon as they’re available’ in your updates control panel. If you are eager to try some of the features outlined above, that unfortunately means opting to install the March non-security preview release. You must also ensure the host apps (Paint, Photos etc) are up-to-date via the Microsoft Store. Remember, the expanded feature rollout availability will also vary based on your location and language selection.

Considering x86 PCs with NPU-packing processors have been available for months, Microsoft has been rather tardy in breaking its most attractive Copilot+ features out from their Qualcomm-only rut. According to our editor-in-chief, you all haven’t been missing much, though. Not long after launch, the Copilot+ features were judged to be “a bad joke.” Moreover, the much heralded Recall feature remains in (re)development after all the security and privacy concerns that were raised.

Title: GlobalFoundries mulls UMC takeover in effort dubbed 'Project Ultron'
Description:
GlobalFoundries is mulling a possible merger with Taiwanese semiconductor producer United Microelectronics Corp. to strengthen their shared role in making chips using mature and specialty process technologies, according to an assessment document reviewed by Tom's Hardware.

The document outlines plans for 'Project Ultron,' which is meant to create a powerhouse controlling a significant share of the global production of chips. However, the plan will likely face major financial, political, and regulatory challenges. Nikkei has also reported on the matter, citing that it has reviewed an assessment plan. UMC has denied involvement, saying it is not currently conducting a merger.

After ceasing to develop leading-edge process technologies in the late 2010s, GlobalFoundries and UMC focused on specialty and mature process technologies. Avoiding competition with TSMC, Intel, and Samsung Foundry enabled the companies to focus on profitability and growth.

The semiconductor market in general, and the foundry market in particular, have changed significantly in recent years, however. SMIC has become a much bigger competitor than it was seven or eight years ago, and China has invested tens of billions of dollars into fabs that use mature process technologies. By contrast, GlobalFoundries's revenue has declined since 2022, whereas UMC's revenue has stagnated in recent years after peaking in 2022.

Tim Breen, named GlobalFoundries's next chief executive in February, will take over in April and is considering acquiring UMC, one of GF's main rivals. Combining two major foundries would create a stronger competitor in the mature-node segment (e.g., 28nm and above), essential for automotive, industrial, and legacy applications.

The combined company is expected to control around 28% of the mainstream node foundry revenue, and a greater scale would enable better pricing power, operational efficiency, and stronger negotiating leverage with customers. The GF-UMC, if combined, will still be smaller than TSMC, which controls 44% of the mainstream node share.

There is a rationale for GlobalFoundries to buy its rival and for UMC to become a part of GF. The mature-node segment is increasingly threatened by low-cost Chinese fabs, and a combined GF-UMC entity could consolidate global capacity and better compete on cost, scale, and reliability. Also, UMC and GF have different but complementary customer sets, so a merger could enable cross-selling, better utilization of fabs, and more diversified revenue streams, reducing business risks.

Stay On the Cutting Edge: Get the Tom's Hardware Newsletter Get Tom's Hardware's best news and in-depth reviews, straight to your inbox. Contact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors

Also, UMC is heavily concentrated in Taiwan, while GF operates fabs in the U.S., Germany, and Singapore, so a merger would spread geographic risk, reduce reliance on Taiwan, and appeal to customers and governments looking for supply chain resilience. Taiwan would still lead with 40% of capacity (UMC), followed by Singapore with 25% (shared by both), and smaller shares in China (11%), Germany (9%), the USA (9%), and Japan (6%). Growth is expected in the USA, Germany, and Singapore, while capacity in China and Taiwan is projected to decline.

Last but not least, GlobalFoundries – UMC will have the scale to develop new 'single-digit nanometer' process technologies, which will open doors to new applications and design wins for the combined company, according to the document. However, it remains to be seen whether it will invest in sub-10nm process technologies to compete against TSMC, Intel, and Samsung Foundry.

While the idea for GlobalFoundries to acquire UMC is an ambitious project that has a lot of rationale, it will be hard to accomplish. The market capitalization of GlobalFoundries is $20.41 billion, whereas the market capitalization of UMC is $16.86 billion. GF does not have the cash to acquire UMC now, so it will either have to take on debt, issue more shares, or ask its main investor, Mubadala, for cash.

However, even if funding is secured, regulatory barriers could prevent the transaction from happening. If GlobalFoundries were to take control after a deal, that outcome would likely be opposed by the Taiwanese government. Chinese approval could be hard to obtain too as the new entity will be a tough rival for Chinese mature nodes fabs. However, if the merged company commits to build additional capacity in China, this could change the mind of regulatory organizations in the People's Republic.

Title: The OnePlus 12 is still a powerhouse in 2025 - and it's on sale for a limited time
Description:
ZDNET's key takeaways The OnePlus 12 typically sells for a starting price of $799.

It was the company's most complete handset in 2024, with the fastest charging speeds on the market (both wired and wireless), a flagship camera system, premium build quality, and reliable performance.

The lack of generative AI features is felt, but for many, that may not be a problem. View now at OnePlus View now at Amazon View now at Best Buy more buying choices

OnePlus is holding a new promotion for its old flagship phone. By entering the promo code "SPRING25" at checkout, you shave $150 off the OnePlus 12's price tag. Be aware that this deal only applies to the $900 model, which has 16GB of RAM and 512GB of storage.

While last year's focus for smartphone makers was unquestionably on AI -- it was the mobile trend of the year -- the OnePlus 12 is unabashedly a phone first, AI companion second kind of device. Instead of prematurely jumping onto the AI bandwagon, promoting its phones with features that aren't readily available, the Shenzhen manufacturer prioritized aspects that mattered more, such as charging tech, battery life, and performance.

Also: Amazon's Spring Sale is over, but this Google Pixel 9 offer at Target is still my favorite spring phone deal live now

The result? A smartphone that excels at the things you actually want and need. I find it very difficult to recommend any other mobile device in 2025.

My fondness for the OnePlus 12 is part of a bigger story. The device is the most complete handset from a company notorious for settling in small but invaluable areas -- whether it's the omission of wireless charging, a better low-light camera, or an official IP rating. The OnePlus 12 has all three of those features and a very competitive price, especially in today's market. Prices start at $799 (sans deals).

While that price is a $100 jump from the older OnePlus 11, the difference in user experience is very noticeable, from the feel and polish of the marble-like Flowy Emerald finish to the way the device optimizes its RAM, of which it has plenty of (up to 16GB). The OnePlus 12 looks and feels better to me than the Samsung Galaxy S24 Plus and Google Pixel 9 Pro, for example. The device's edges are curved to make it sit smoothly in my hand, and I don't struggle to press any of the buttons.

Also: 12 Android phone settings you should change to dramatically increase battery life

Correction: I don't struggle to press any of the buttons except for the alert slider, which has now been moved to the upper left side of the phone. For something that requires a toggle instead of a press, physically switching from "Ring" to "Vibrate" to "Silent" feels more cumbersome than it should. Otherwise, I'm a fan of OnePlus' industrial design, which is a little more distinct now that both Samsung and Google have officially ditched the curved glass form factor.

The OnePlus 12 is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, which brings improved day-to-day performance and better efficiency of on-device AI applications. I've had no problem putting the phone through its paces, whether it's editing videos on Premiere Rush, playing demanding games like Fortnite and Genshin Impact, or multitasking with a PiP (Picture-in-Picture) video playing. While the marketed peak brightness of 4,500 nits puts even the Galaxy S24's 2,600 value to shame, I only found it to be slightly brighter when outdoors.

Here is the OnePlus 12 (left) next to the Samsung Galaxy S24 Plus (right). Kerry Wan/ZDNET

Aside from Google's stock AI features, such as Magic Compose and Photomoji, this model has no killer generative AI service, as I alluded to in the introduction. That's not a bad thing, especially if you don't factor generative AI into your lifestyle anyway. Having cycled between the OnePlus and Samsung's AI-heavy Galaxy S24 series, I haven't found myself missing the assisted features much.

Also: 5 tools I trust to keep my online conversations private and anonymous

That said, the latest Android 15 update for the OnePlus 12 introduces some familiar generative AI tools that put the device closer to its competitors, such as Circle to Search, AI Unblur, AI Assistant for Notes, and more. The new software version also brings Open Canvas to the phone, a multitasking feature that deploys floating windows for quicker navigation between apps.

The OnePlus 12 features a 50MP wide camera, a 64MP 3x periscope telephoto, and a 48MP ultra-wide. Kerry Wan/ZDNET

One area that I do wish OnePlus flexed its machine-learning muscles more is with the cameras -- specifically, the telephoto lens. While the Sony LYT-808-backed, 50MP main camera does a fantastic (and reliable) job of reproducing lighting and colors in a very natural tone, the telephoto lens falls short for me in two ways: distance and edge detection.

Also: This Anker power bank is on sale and it's my everyday carry - Here's why

Because the telephoto lens is capped to 3x optical zoom, shooting subjects that are further away tends to produce pictures that appear more washed out and lacking in detail. You can view some of my camera samples here.

For images captured with Hasselblad Portrait Mode, the phone can struggle to apply a bokeh effect behind people with fuzzy and springy hairstyles. In both cases, a visual engine that can help amplify or better detect subjects would be immensely helpful.

Kerry Wan/ZDNET

Ultimately, one of the most compelling reasons to buy a OnePlus phone is its battery life and charging speed. For the former, the OnePlus fields a 5,400mAh battery, the biggest on a mainstream smartphone. I've comfortably gotten a good day and a half's worth of usage before needing to charge the device.

Also: I finally found the ultimate car charger for my iPhone - and it's on sale for $25

For the latter, the OnePlus 12 is the fastest in its class, both wired and wireless. The 80W charger that's included in the box has spoiled me, and the 50W wireless charging support -- which only works with OnePlus' first-party dock, to be clear -- outpaces the wired charging rate of competing flagship phones.

ZDNET's buying advice

At a starting price of $550, the OnePlus 12 is the best phone at its price point. It has the most well-rounded feature set ever, 5G support for every major carrier (Verizon included), the fastest charging on the market, and an industrial design that screams premium. It's also a great phone for users who aren't fully bought into the AI craze.

The trade-offs are more of a blur this time around, but from my months of usage, I'd still list the subpar telephoto lens and IP65 rating -- which just misses the mark for the industry standard for water and dust resistance -- as the most notable reasons to think twice about the device. If you can shoulder the compromises, which are more subtle than ever, then I have no problem recommending the latest phone from OnePlus, especially at its Black Friday price.

When will this deal expire? As per OnePlus, this deal will end on April 13, 2025. Title: Apple stuffs 62 holes in iOS and iPados
Description:
The patches are part of the updates to iOS 18.4 and Ipados 18.4. They prevent phishing, the disclosure of confidential data and code execution outside the app sandbox.

Apple has updated its iOS and iPados mobile operating systems to version 18.4. The update contains patches for 62 security gaps. According to Apple's security warning, unauthorized persons can indulge in malicious code.

This applies to a weak point in the component audio. Here an specially designed audio file can trigger an undesirable code version. Also particularly serious should also be classified in the component calendar and power services as well as the library libxPC. As a result, apps could possibly leave their sandbox.

The patches are also intended to prevent apps from accessing confidential user data, data from the Keychain password management can be read out of an iOS backup or that, despite the failed authentication, passwords are automatically used by the autofill function.

The component biometrickit in turn can trigger a system crash with a buffer overflow. Further bugs can lead to the crash of apps, the disclosure of memory contents or apps grant root access. In addition, Safari is susceptible to spoofing and may pass on sensor data without the consent of the user.

Apple not only eliminates the security gaps on current iPhones and iPads with iOS 18. Some patches are also distributed to older devices via iPados 17.7.6, iOS and iPados 16.7.1 as well as iOS and iPados - up to the iPhone 6s from 2015.

Title: Firefox 137: Mozilla introduces tabgroups
Description:
Mozilla has updated its Firefox browser to version 137. The most important innovation is the possibility of summarizing tabs into groups. In addition, the developers remove several serious security gaps.

The taboo function should make it easier to keep an overview of open tabs and to work more productively with Firefox. A new taboo is created by pulling a tab with the mouse onto another tab and stored there. Groups can be marked in color and provided with a name. In addition, tabs can be closed in order to open them again at a later date.

In addition, the search button in the address bar was revised to simplify access to search engines. Under Linux, Firefox now supports the reproduction of videos in HEVC format. In addition, Firefox can now recognize all links in PDF files and make it available as hyperlink.

According to a current security warning, Firefox 137 also stuffs 8 security gaps. Among them are three vulnerabilities, of which a high risk is based. The attackers may trigger a crash of the browser or even insert and execute the harmful code from afar.

Firefox 137 is automatically distributed via the update function of the browser. The new version is available for Windows, MacOS and Linux.

Title: Phone tracking: valuable and at the same time risky
Description:
With a few tricks, the phone tracking can be limited to a minimum.

App permissions

The authorizations can be checked and changed via the control control of the mobile device. For example, iPhone users can click on the "Data Protection & Security" tab and then go to the location services. The location settings of the individual apps are stored here. It is best to configure the apps so that they have to ask first before you can use a location or that the location may only be used while the app is open. It is a little different with Android phones. As a rule, however, the location symbol can be typed in the settings and switched on or off for all or individual apps. The options are similar to iOS at the various manufacturers.

iPhone data protection

Apple also has further options to reduce tracking by third -party providers. In the "Data Protection & Security" setting, there is a switch on the "Tracking" tab that can be used to allow or reject the request for tracking. If this option is deactivated, new app requests are automatically rejected.

Personalized advertising

Data protection experts recommend blocking the internal ad identification of Google or Apple devices. This can be done on the iPhone under the data protection setting. Here you scroll for Apple Advertising and deactivated personalized advertising. On newer Android smartphones you also go to the data protection settings and then to advertisements where you should delete the advertising ID.

Precise location

Regardless of whether it is an Android or Apple device, both have the possibility to be able to precisely determine the location of the device. This works via the signals and data integrated sensors such as the barometer or accelerometer. This means that the mobile device can precisely determine the location-even if, for example, there is no GPS signal within a building. If you don't want an app to access this information, you should only release the general location information. To do this, the setting "location accuracy" is deactivated on Android smartphones and on the iPhone you switch on or off this feature for each individual app.

Google account

In addition to the app permissions, the authorizations for the Google account should also be checked. On the Google account you go to the section "Data & Data Protection", where the controls are located for the course of the location. In the last changes, the course will be deleted after three months - however, this can be changed individually in the default settings.

Browser

Popular smartphone browsers such as Safari or Chrome can also reveal the location of a mobile phone. This can be avoided by using other browsers such as Duckduckgo, Firefox Focus or Ecosia. In the event that you have to access the location via an IP address, these data protection-oriented browsers will request a location approval and do not fall back on it.

Find my device

Telefone or tablets can be searched for with the functions "Find My" by Apple or "Find My Device" from Google. This function can also be deactivated if necessary, if necessary, if there is a suspicion that someone has accessed their own Apple or Google account.

Title: Microsoft überarbeitet Blue Screen of Death
Description:
Der bei Abstürzen angezeigte Bildschirm soll übersichtlicher und einfacher werden. Microsoft testet den neuen Blue Screen of Death derzeit für Windows 11 im Insider-Programm.

Microsoft hat eine Funktion seines Betriebssystems überarbeitet, die Anwender in der Regel nicht nutzen möchten: den Blue Screen of Death. Die Anzeige, die bei Abstürzen beziehungsweise unerwarteten Neustarts von Windows präsentiert wird, soll vor allem einfacher und übersichtlicher werden.

Die Änderungen stehen derzeit Teilnehmern des Windows-Insider-Programms für Windows 11 zur Verfügung. Microsoft zufolge werden Nutzer künftig die gleichen Informationen sehen wie bisher, aber in einem neuen Design – das zudem auf die namensgebende blaue Farbe verzichtet.

„Wir stellen eine neue, schlankere Benutzeroberfläche für unerwartete Neustarts vor, die besser mit den Designprinzipien von Windows 11 übereinstimmt und unser Ziel unterstützt, die Benutzer so schnell wie möglich wieder produktiv zu machen“, so Microsoft in einer Ankündigung zum neuesten Windows 11 Insider-Build.

Ein Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) wird als Reaktion auf einen schwerwiegenden Systemfehler oder -absturz ausgelöst, der häufig auf einen Hardware- oder Treiberkonflikt zurückzuführen ist. Windows kann sich von dieser Art von Fehler nicht erholen, so dass ein Computer neu gestartet werden muss, um sich selbst zu bereinigen. Der typische BSOD teilt Nutzern mit, dass auf ihrem PC ein Problem aufgetreten ist, identifiziert oft die Quelle des Konflikts und bietet einen QR-Code mit Details zur Problembehandlung.

Das neue Design verzichtet laut Windows Latest auf den QR-Code und ein Smiley mit stirnrunzelndem Gesicht. Zudem soll der Hintergrund nun schwarz sein, wie während der Installation von Windows-Updates. In der Vorschau für Windows-Insider ist der Hintergrund indes grün. Es bleibt also abzuwarten, für welche Farbe sich Microsoft entscheidet, sobald die Funktion für die Allgemeinheit ausgerollt wird.

Title: Fujitsu launches consulting specialist organization----dedicated to problem solving and change support
Description:
On April 1st, Fujitsu announced that it had established a new consulting specialist organization. The new organization will accelerate the resolution of issues and support client companies in their transformation.

The company launched its consulting business brand "Uvance Wayfinders" in February 2024, and has expanded its consulting business, focusing on internal human resource reskills, and has established a foundation for business expansion. Among these issues, strengthening the creation of business demand has become an important issue to accelerate the growth of the consulting business.

Therefore, we established this organization to be a leadership team with extensive experience and track record in the consulting industry, and consultants with advanced expertise and ability to support implementation in solving problems. Consultants will be deployed at each location and will lead the project in collaboration with the Fujitsu Group's customer service division and advanced technology divisions such as AI and quantum computing.

Fujitsu Executive Vice President and Chief Revenue Officer (CRO), Shunsuke Onishi, commented, "By establishing a dedicated consulting organization and establishing an experienced leadership team, Fujitsu will support customers in transformation and accelerate their realization with a consulting lead approach. Uvance Wayfinders will contribute to the sustainable growth of our customers and society as a whole by combining cutting-edge technology and business to solve complex, unknown issues."

With the establishment of this new organization, the Fujitsu Group will bring together the knowledge and technology of the Fujitsu Group, and contribute to transformation that goes beyond the boundaries of the industry and to solve social issues through its business model, Fujitsu Uvance.

Title: Investment in Generated AI by Companies, with more investments in 2025 - Gartner forecast
Description:
As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes increasingly essential for business operations and consumer products, businesses are expected to spend significantly on artificial AI. Gartner's latest forecasts show that this high-profile AI sector spending totaled $644 billion worldwide in 2025, an increase of 76.4% compared to 2024.

However, the current generation AI is still in its early stages and suffers from the problems of many defects and errors. A classic example is that AI tends to cause halcinations and generate inaccurate, inappropriate, or misleading answers. As a result, many chief information officers and technology executives are disappointed by the high frequency of AI making mistakes.

Still, the future prospects of generating AI means AI providers and other companies continue to invest huge amounts in the technology. The aim is to address current weaknesses through enhancing and improving the scale, performance and reliability of AI models.

Due to the current limitations of generator AI, 2025 will result in a rigorous scrutiny of corporate projects, said John-David Lovelock, Vice President of Distinguished at Gartner. So where do businesses put their time, effort and money?

"As 2024 ambitious internal projects will be rigorously vetted in 2025, as CIOs will choose commercial off-the-shelf solutions for feasibility and high business value," he said, "Even as models continue to improve, CIOs will be able to reduce proof of concept (PoC) and in-house development efforts, and instead focus on the capabilities of the generated AI provided by existing software providers."

Approximately 80% of the expected increase in AI-related spending will be spent exclusively on incorporating AI into existing hardware such as servers, PCs and smartphones. However, businesses' spending on AI software and AI services should also skyrocket. Looking at Gartner's forecasts, companies are expected to spend $27.8 billion on services, $37.2 billion on software, $180.6 billion on servers, and $398.3 billion on devices. Both have been a significant increase compared to 2024.

Gartner also mentions the further distant future, saying manufacturers will be able to incorporate AI capabilities into more and more devices. Whether or not consumers want such a feature.

"Whether or not the market will get back on track will depend heavily on the increasing adoption of AI-enabled devices, and by 2028, AI-enabled devices will likely be able to make almost all of the consumer device market," Lovelock said, noting that "but consumers aren't looking for these features. If manufacturers incorporate AI as a standard feature for consumer devices, consumers should be forced to purchase such devices."

Title: Should I be a science and engineering background in order to become an engineer?
Description:
I think many people have taken a step as new employees as they enter the new year as April begins. I think most readers of this series are accepting new employees. In any case, I told you last time that if you can use new encounters as a species of serendipity, you won't have to worry about your job being taken away by AI. I myself have been working on a new job since April in search of serendipity. I look forward to all sorts of coincidences.

Now, what should new employees who have begun their careers as engineers or students aiming for a career as engineers should learn is a profound topic. To put it more straightforwardly, I would like to think about the topic of "Do engineers have to graduate from the Faculty of Science and Technology?"

Over 90% of the engineers I have worked with have graduated from the university's Faculty of Science and Technology. It is in particular true that many people graduated from departments in electrical, electronic, information and communications. However, even in science and engineering, there are many cases where people majored in mechanical engineering, physics, mathematics, etc., while many people from so-called liberal arts faculties such as economics, law, and literature have been active as engineers.

"Dialect" too

Telecommunications carrier engineers often do not engage in tasks like device development or program coding. Of course, there is no way telecommunications carrier engineers are involved in device development or coding. However, it is safe to say that telecommunications companies often decide specifications, order them from manufacturers or system integrators, and have them develop and manufacture them.

In practice, we purchase commercially available communication devices and servers, connect them to media such as optical fiber, and provide services with appropriate settings. Therefore, it is important to obtain and organize information on what kind of equipment is being developed, manufactured and sold by various manufacturers, and compare and consider it.

Furthermore, for devices that have been chosen to adopt, it is necessary to memorize many commands*1 and be able to quickly and accurately set up the configuration.

*1: Most of the current devices can be set using the Graphical User Interface (GUI), but many engineers often use the Command Line Interface (CLI).

It is also important to decide and coordinate what protocols to use when connecting with other telecommunications carriers and users. Therefore, we are committed to understanding the protocol and how to adjust which parameters and how to provide the best network service.

Selecting equipment, connecting to networks such as optical fibers, introducing configurations, and understanding and using protocols - if you write this, once you set it optimally, you may think that the machine will move on its own.

However, the device may be hardware malfunctioning, and software may contain bugs. Also, optical fiber buried underground can be cut off by road construction, and protocols can be dialects and versions, so it is usually not easy*2.

Title: Inns where IT specialists are not available, DX in the tourism industry - Learn about using the web from Fukushima City
Description:
地域活性化が叫ばれて久しいが、その軸の一つとなるのがシステム全般のデジタルトランスフォーメーション（DX）だ。福島市の観光地域づくりを推進している法人（DMO）福島市観光コンベンション協会（福島市）も、DXに取り組みながら観光ウェブメディア「福島市観光ノート」などを展開しているが、その実情はどうなっているのだろうか。本稿では、宿泊施設向けITソリューションを展開するtripla（トリプラ）の代表取締役CEOの高橋和久が、地方都市の観光業におけるDXについて解説する。

triplaではホテル予約エンジンやAIチャットボットなどを提供しており、企業が抱えるさまざまな課題解決をサポートしている。当社がサポートしている福島市観光コンベンション協会の場合、運営しているメディア福島市観光ノートのアクセス数をアップさせられても、観光スポットや宿泊施設の紹介コンテンツと化し、宿泊予約に関しては、オンライン旅行代理店（OTA）頼みになり、シームレスな予約導線を確保できていなかったことが課題となっていた。



「福島市観光ノート」 「福島市観光ノート」

福島市観光コンベンション協会 データサイエンティスト コンテンツマーケターの三宅晃司氏は「民間のOTAは、集客効果はあるものの、どうしても手数料がかさむ。また継続的に利用することで地域外にお金が流れてしまう。そこで自社で予約システムを確立し、地域にお金を再還元する流れを作ることにつながっていく」と明かしているが、実はほかにも課題があった。

同協会では福島市の宿泊施設の利用者に対するアンケートやふるさと納税制度の利用者のデータを保有しており、顧客情報やマーケティング材料となる膨大なデータを蓄積していたものの、有効活用ができていなかったという。

そもそも福島市観光コンベンション協会は、福島市観光ノートの運用のほか、福島市へのふるさと納税の事務局全般や、福島市内の宿泊施設の利用者に対するアンケートを実施している。いうなれば、宿泊施設の利用者のみならず、ふるさと納税制度の利用者など福島市に興味関心がある層のデータを持ち、「デスティネーション（旅行の目的地）マーケティング」に有効活用できる材料を持ち合わせている状態だった。

そのため、福島市観光コンベンション協会では、福島市観光ノートの発信力や、保有する顧客データを活用し、福島市観光ノート上で宿泊予約であったり、一人ひとりに応じたレコメンドを掲出したりできる、DMO版のOTAの構築を目指した。

データ取得からOTA事業までを担うDMOとは

同協会がこれらのデータを所持しているのは、DMOであるからだ。DMOは観光庁から情報や人材、財源などさまざまな支援を受けられ、OTA機能も観光庁の調査事業に協力するという意味合いから保持している。そうした取り組みについて、三宅氏は次のように説明した。

「今回のDMO版OTA事業は、国と福島市がやりたいと思っていたマーケティング強化の方向性が合致して実現に至った。DMO版OTAをはじめとした事業の根底には、観光産業のDX推進に関わるマーケティング強化があって、例えば観光庁が課題を提示して、どう解決していくかされわれがアイデアを出すケースもある」

なお、今回活用した観光庁の調査事業において重視する項目の一つに「汎用（はんよう）性」があったというが、三宅氏は「我々がトリプラとともに作り上げたDMO版OTAが、ほかのDMOでも使えるような汎用性があることがポイントになると考えた。それがやがて業界全体、そして日本のためになっていく。それこそが国が求める汎用性なのではないか」と解釈したという。

今後はOTAなどで集めたデータを基に、「福島が好きな人」に対して的確にアプローチしていく予定だという。クーポンの配布や観光に関するおすすめ情報の提供のほか、宿泊施設を予約する時に、通常予約に加えてふるさと納税制度を活用する選択肢も設け、宿泊代金の一部をふるさと納税制度でまかなうような形も検討中で、観光業の活性化と地域貢献の両立を目指している。

今回のDMO版OTAの構築に当たり、同協会が地域の宿泊施設とコミュニケーションをとる中で、大きく分けて3つのマーケティング傾向があると感じたそうだ。

「1つ目は、ある程度の規模がある大きな旅館などにはマーケティング担当者がいて、担当者が自分でシステムの管理や設定ができるレベルのITリテラシーを持っているため、比較的スムーズにマーケティング戦略やDXを進められているケース。2つ目は、代表者がマーケティングも担当していて、ほかの業務が忙しいためにマーケティングにまで手が回らず、繁忙期または閑散期でも適切な値段設定ができていないため、顧客へのアプローチなども後回しになっているケース。3つ目はマーケティングに対する知識が全くないという理由から、すべて外注しているケース。この場合はプロに任せられるものの、手数料がかさんでしまいがちで、自社でやろうと考えてもスイッチングコストがかかったり、契約期間の縛りがあったりして、やめにくいというデメリットがある」

同協会では特に2つ目、3つ目のケースに対して、宿泊施設側にDX推進のためのシステム導入などもサポートしており、福島市観光ノートをOTAとして活用することを提案している。

同メディアを通して予約を受けることによって予約情報が福島市のデータとして蓄積され、さらに宿泊施設はこれまで他社のOTAに支払っていた費用が抑えられ、余った費用を広告費などに充てられ、集客につなげられる。地域と宿泊施設の双方にとっての好循環となっていくだろう。

「お客さまを呼んでくれる」ではだめ、宿泊施設に求められる意識改革

とはいえその道のりは簡単ではない。宿泊施設が、同協会のような観光協会に対してネガティブなイメージを持っていたり、そもそも外部からのアドバイスに抵抗を感じたりする場合もある。

福島市のみならず、その地方ならではの商慣習から抜け出すことは難しく、新しいものを取り入れるのが難しいという例は珍しくないと、三宅氏は明かす。

「自分たちで集客するよりも、OTAや旅行会社がお客さまを呼んでくれるという認識を持っている宿泊施設はいまだに存在する。その場合、顧客ターゲットやペルソナがそもそも定まっておらず、カスタマージャーニーマップもまとまっていないため、ゆえに客層に合わせたマーケティングもできない。ただ単にお客さまが宿泊して終わりではなく、宿泊施設として今後どうなっていきたいか、そのためにどんな施策が必要なのかを自分たちで考えなければならないという意識を持つことで、DXの必要性やマーケティング戦略の重要性を実感することにも結びついていくかもしれない」

なお、福島市観光ノートは年間400万PVという実績があり、広告プラットフォームとしての基盤は十分。OTAとしての機能のほか、観光にまつわる情報、ふるさと納税制度の返礼品といった地域の名産品にかかわる情報などを網羅的に発信することにより、地域の観光業、ひいては地域全体を盛り上げることになっていくだろう。

同協会では、これからも福島市との連携により力を入れ、市が行うキャンペーンやイベントとの連動企画や、キャンペーンやイベント参加者のデータを宿泊施設のマーケティングに生かすことなども考えているという。地域経済の持続的な発展のキーワードとなっている「官民連携」と「DX」だが、同協会が旅行業界におけるモデルケースを提示してくれる日が待ち遠しい。

Title: The future of B2B marketing and the evolution of ABM with intent AI
Description:
ABM history is the beginning of precision targeting

Account-based marketing (ABM) emerged in the 1990s as a strategy for business (B2B) marketing with corporate customers. Unlike traditional mass marketing, ABM was initially established as an approach to developing individual marketing initiatives, focusing on specific companies (accounts), and attracted attention as a method that allows for high return on investment (ROI) by sending customized messages to target accounts.

This marketing method is known as "precision targeting" (hyperprecision targeting), and has begun the method of delivering the most suitable advertising and promotions to the target audience. Precision targeting improves advertising click-through rates and conversion rates, contributes to customer re-engagement, increases engagement and lifetime value, and enables marketing to be more efficient.

As the 2000s began, ABM became even more refined with the evolution of customer relationship management (CRM) systems and marketing automation (MA) tools. Companies will be able to integrate customer data and adopt a more personalized approach.

However, in reality, despite its ideal, a packaged CRM requires the support of a large consultant, or it is not easy to meet the needs of individual companies due to packaging constraints, and sometimes the development of scratch costs can be incurred, resulting in many manual processes, making it extremely difficult to deploy large scale.

The transition and challenges to data-driven marketing

Currently, ABM is becoming more advanced with advances in digital technology. With the use of AI and big data analytics, businesses can understand intent data that indicates potential customers' purchasing intentions and take a more precise approach. On the other hand, there are several challenges when looking ahead to ABM.

Title: AI inside revamps the AI ​​inside Cube series edge computers -- Adds models ideal for small-scale operations
Description:
On April 1st, AI inside revamped its product lineup for the Edge Computer "AI inside Cube" series.

AI inside is a company that conducts research and development and social implementation of generated AI/large-scale language models (LLM) and autonomous AI. We develop and provide LLM "PolySphere," which specializes in Japanese document processing, the generation AI agent "Heylix," and the AI-OCR "DX Suite." It is used by approximately 3,000 companies, including government agencies, local governments, and private companies, and approximately 60,000 users.



Overview of the AI ​​inside Cube series (provided by AI inside) Overview of the AI ​​inside Cube series (provided by AI inside)

Specifically, the series, which enables AI to be used in on-premises environments and data centers, has been newly added with "AI inside Cube Lite" for small-scale operations. This has enabled the small start to allow flexible AI utilization in advanced security environments to be used.

This series is an edge computer equipped with powerful GPUs, dedicated hardware and unique AI management software. This combines digitalization with privacy protection. It's easy to install and start using, and hardware and software are provided in subscription format, reducing initial costs. Additionally, by installing DX Suite, you can efficiently digitize the documents.

It is suitable for use in areas where confidentiality and legal regulations are required, such as in finance, public institutions, and medical fields. By operating on-premises, we reduce the risk of data leaks and improve business efficiency while complying with laws and regulations. It also supports large amounts of data and high-frequency processing, allowing a variety of documents and drawings to be digitized, including contracts, manuals, and architectural drawings.

Title: ALSOK and NTT Com to streamline avatar support at Osaka and Kansai Expo -- Utilizing LLM "tsuzumi"
Description:
At the 2025 Osaka-Kansai Expo, Integrated Security Security (ALSOK) and NTT Communications (NTT Com) will conduct a demonstration experiment using NTT Com's large-scale language model (LLM) "tsuzumi," in order to improve the accuracy of attendance using avatars and improve operational efficiency. By combining avatars and LLM, we aim to streamline security operations and reduce the number of required personnel. The two companies announced this on April 1st.

According to both companies, in recent years, the security industry, like most industries, has become a serious labor shortage. Therefore, there is a need to utilize avatars and AI to improve business efficiency. However, the information handled in security services is much of the information that cannot be leaked to the outside world from the perspective of security and privacy, and there are restrictions on using cloud services. Additionally, there was a challenge in dealing with highly specialized security services, which involves a huge cost to learn and adjust AI.



Images of the operation of avatar and tsuzumi (provided by presentation materials) Images of the operation of avatar and tsuzumi (provided by presentation materials)

Therefore, by utilizing tsuzumi, an industry-specific and lightweight LLM that can be used in a closed environment, we aim to operate an avatar that combines security and efficiency. By operating in a closed environment provided by NTT Com, visitors can safely handle information that is highly privacy and confidential.

Specifically, three avatars will be installed at the pavilion "The Future of Life" at the Osaka-Kansai Expo, to respond to inquiries from visitors and provide information on areas off-limits. If you have difficult questions with an avatar, switch to an ALSOK operator. The avatar is AVITA's "AVACOM."

In addition, by summarizing the conversations between visitors and avatars in tsuzumi, it is possible to streamline the analysis of inquiry trends and report creation. We aim to improve the efficiency of the overall guidance work by adjusting the avatar based on the analysis results and increasing the number of cases where avatars can be handled with only avatars.

The implementation period is from April 1st to October 13th. ALSOK will be responsible for central management, avatar management, and manned operators, while NTT Com will build a summary system and provide reports using tsuzumi.

If the two companies can confirm the effectiveness of this initiative, they plan to apply tsuzumi to various fields of security work and promote business efficiency for the entire security industry.

Title: Datadog opens new office in Osaka--Strengthen sales and support system in the western Japan area
Description:
Datadog has established a new business base in Osaka as it expands its business in the western Japan area. We will strengthen sales activities and customer response to customers, mainly in the Kansai and Chukyo regions. Datadog Japan, a Japanese subsidiary, announced this on April 1st.

Datadog offers a SaaS platform that integrates a wide range of capabilities, including infrastructure monitoring, application performance monitoring (APM), log management, and cloud security. This will help companies of a wide range of sizes and industries to drive digital transformation (DX) and cloud migration. It also helps to enhance collaboration between development, operations, security and business teams, helping to reduce application time to market and problem-solving times.

Since entering Japan in 2018, the company has steadily expanded its business, and now approximately 2,000 domestic companies have introduced its products. By reflecting customer feedback in product development and providing an integrated platform for cloud applications, we have contributed to solving problems in the Japanese market.

In 2023, we opened our head office and data center in Japan, allowing us to provide services that comply with Japan's privacy and security regulations. We also provide a Japanese language skill certification program and focus on improving the technical capabilities of our customers and partners.

The company believes that the western Japan area is an important region that will drive the growth of the Japanese economy, and that software investments are also on the rise. In addition, with the Osaka Expo in 2025, it is expected that infrastructure and industry will also be revitalized.

Title: Local account creation methods are unavailable in Windows 11 -- another workaround remains
Description:
Microsoft has announced that it will remove the script "bypassnro.cmd" in its Insider build of Windows 11. This was one way to sign in without a Microsoft account.

Here's how I explained in my previous article: First, before the account screen appears in the initial setup, press "Shift" + "F10" to open the command prompt. Next, enter "oobe\bypassnro" at the command prompt. This will restart your PC and return to the Windows 11 setup screen. Restart work where you left off and make sure your internet connection is disconnected. This will prompt you to enter a name to create a local account on the account screen.

Currently, this workaround is only removed in Insider builds, but will soon be applicable to the Windows 11 production version as well. Microsoft emphasized this as a positive approach, claiming it would "improve Windows 11 security and user experience." It also states that the change will allow "all users with internet connections and Microsoft accounts to complete the setup."

I wonder if I'll have no choice other than choosing a Microsoft account when installing or updating Windows? There are still several workarounds left.

According to Windows Central, a user suggests the following steps: First, during setup, press "Shift" + "F10" to open the command prompt. Next, enter "start ms-cxh:localonly" at the command prompt. You will then see a Windows 10 style interface that lets you create a username and password for your local account.

Windows Central has confirmed that this workaround is effective, but Microsoft may block this method in the future.

Another option is to set up Windows 11 with a Microsoft account and then switch to a local account later. Go to Settings > Accounts > User Information, click Switch to Sign in with a Local Account and follow the instructions.

Additionally, there is a way to use the free third-party tool, Rufus. Rufus can remove Microsoft account requirements when installing Windows from an ISO image file and automatically create a local account with a specific username.

Exchanges between Microsoft and local accounts have been going on for years, and there has been a never-ending battle in which someone will find a new workaround and the company will ban it if Microsoft removes it.

So why does the company strongly recommend using a Microsoft account instead of a local account? This is because it is convenient for Windows users. The claim is that it can use the same authentication information on multiple products, access services such as "OneDrive," and sync settings between different PCs.

However, Microsoft accounts have privacy and security concerns. Microsoft is using this account to monitor users' activities and market their products and services. That's why they're trying to get them to use a Microsoft account instead of a local account.

In the long run, there should be no fights between Microsoft and its customers. Local accounts are a valid option and should be left to the user to decide. However, the company always prioritizes its profits.

Title: Microsoft reviews blue screen display for Windows 11--Insider build
Description:
It's not a good thing to see a Blue Screen (BSOD) error on Windows. But Microsoft is at least trying to make the screen look better.

The changes currently being deployed for Windows 11 Insiders make the BSOD error screen simpler and more refined. The same technical information as before is displayed, but the design has been completely redesigned.

In an announcement regarding the latest Windows 11 Insider build, the company states: "We're previewing a new, simpler UI for unexpected reboots. It follows Windows 11 design principles and aims to help users get back to work quickly."

BSOD errors are caused by fatal system errors or crashes, often due to hardware or driver conflicts. Windows cannot recover from this error, so the computer restarts to fix the problem. A typical BSOD error will tell your PC that there is a problem and present two-dimensional code that identifies the cause of the conflict and shows you how to troubleshoot the problem. Windows's grumpy faces are also displayed.

The new designs have abolished the traditional blue screen, a grumpy look and two-dimensional code. According to Windows Latest analysis, the new screen is based on the black color that is seen when updating Windows. The screen previewed by Windows Insider is green. I'll be looking forward to seeing which colour will be adopted in the end.

Recently, Microsoft has been focusing on making various screens look simpler and more unified. The company has also reviewed the sign-in screen completely based on the "Fluent Design System" to create a more streamlined and unified look.

Most of the design changes have been deployed to Windows Insiders using Windows 11 24H2 on the Beta, Dev and Canary channels. Microsoft has not stated when these changes will be applied to the Windows 11 production version. Some may be gradually rolled out over several months, but it may not be applicable until the official release of Windows 11 25H2 in the second half of 2025.

Title: The experimental version of "Gemini 2.5 Pro" is now available to all users.
Description:
On March 29th, US time, Google announced that it has released the "most intelligent" AI model, the Gemini 2.5 Pro (experimental), which it announced on the 25th, to all users.

Gemini 2.5 is a thinking model that allows you to infer through thought before responding, following the Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking model that appeared in December.

Gemini 2.5 Pro (experimental) is "Humanity's Last Exam" (HLE), surpassing OpenAI's "OpenAI o3-mini" and Anthropic's "Claude 3.7 Sonnet." HLE is a benchmark test recently developed to address "benchmark saturation," which makes industry testing problems too easy for fast-evolving models. Therefore, although it is a relatively difficult test to achieve excellent results, the Gemini 2.5 scored 18.8%, exceeding the o3-mini 14% (there is only text and no images) and the Claude 3.7 Sonnet 8.9%.



Provided by: Google Provided by: Google

Gemini 2.5 has already won the top spot on the Chatbot Arena leaderboard and surpasses competing models in general benchmarks in science, mathematics and coding. However, although the difference is generally small, considering the speed at which new models evolve, it can be said to be within the scope of our predictions. Google reports that Gemini 2.5 Pro (experimental) has improved in inference, multimodal and agent functions, even if there is only a "one-line prompt."

In a post on X, Google said it would deploy "Gemini 2.5 Pro (experimental)" to all users "rate-limited." It is said to be compatible with mobile devices soon. It is said that "Gemini Advanced" users will be provided with a larger context window and extended access.

Title: World introduces Toshiba Tech's RFID solution at approximately 1,100 stores
Description:
World has introduced an inventory solution that utilizes RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) technology at its apparel stores. The provider, Toshiba Tech, announced it on March 31st.

Toshiba Tech will attach RFID tags to all products sold in stores, and use the RFID system "RFLogispert" and the RFID hand reader "UF-3000" to speed up inventory and search for specific products.

The solution began to be implemented in February, and is currently operating at approximately 1,100 of World's stores. Toshiba Tech aims to improve the efficiency of logistics warehouse operations by providing warehouse inbound and shipping solutions using RFID technology to the world.

Title: Microsoft realizes a passwordless world ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Description:
Microsoft is completely reviewing its sign-in screen to make it easier to authenticate your account using passwordless methods, including passkeys. Robin Goldstein, partner director of product management for the cloud identity service Microsoft Identity, explained in a blog post dated March 27th, that the new sign-in process will be displayed on services such as Outlook, Xbox, Windows, and Microsoft 365.

The new screen will start to appear on Xbox in March and will be rolled out sequentially until the end of April. At that point, over 3 billion Microsoft users around the world will see improved processes when logging in to Windows on PCs and Microsoft services on the web.

Streamline UX in Authentication

One of the main objectives of the new process is to make passwordless options like passkey, face recognition, and fingerprint authentication easy to use. The current sign-in screen uses a password as the default login method. Considering the transition to a more simple and secure authentication format, it was necessary to change.

"By streamlining the UX (user experience) design for authentication, we were able to rethink the default sign-in experience and place even more emphasis on ease of use and safety," Goldstein said. "In recent years, we've made several enhancements, including the ability to completely remove passwords from accounts and the ability to sign in using a passkey instead of a password. Our new UX has been optimized for passwordless passkey preferences."

A new experience begins with the sign-up process. If you sign up for Microsoft services with an existing email address, you will not be asked to create a password. Instead, the one-time security code required to obtain access rights will be sent by email. Once you log in, you will be asked to create a passkey. Once a passkey is created, it becomes the default sign-in option whenever possible.

"Subscribe a user's email address to a new Microsoft account so you can start from a recoverable state and no need to create a new Microsoft password. There is a risk that your password could be forgotten or guessed by an attacker," Goldstein explained.

"All you need is to authenticate your email with one-time code. This will be the default credentials for your new account and you can start without a password. In addition, you can now link your account with an email address in case you want to restore your account or start on a new device."

Microsoft is also revamping the flow of the sign-in screen. Depending on your current login method, multiple screens may be displayed, each of which may offer different options. This can make the entire UX more complicated and complicated. The new process is expected to make the overall flow smoother by reconfiguring the screen in a more intuitive way and simplifying each screen.

The Aesthetics of Fluent Design System

Next, we will introduce the appearance and operational feel of the new sign-in screen. Microsoft has redesigned the sign-in screen with its design concept, "Fluent Design System," to achieve an orderly, unified look. The screen is placed more centrally so that users can concentrate without being distracted. Plus, it is displayed properly on any device, from smartphones to desktop monitors.

One of the features that was often requested by user feedback was support for dark mode. Users can select the Light/Dark mode according to their preference. The selected mode will be automatically enabled each time you sign in.

When I tried out a new sign-in screen on Xbox, the login experience was improved. I usually use an authentication app to authenticate my Microsoft account. In addition to enhancing this approach, the new experience also offers other passwordless authentication methods.

How to try a new process now

The new screen will first be adopted in web/mobile applications. Support for Windows and Windows applications follows. To see how the new process feels, try it on the Xbox website. Otherwise, you can check the overall operation by waiting until the end of April.

Title: SoftBank G invests up to USD 40 billion in OpenAI - expected to complete by December
Description:
On April 1, SoftBank Group (SBG) announced that it had finally agreed to an additional investment of up to 40 billion US dollars (5.9808 trillion yen) in OpenAI Global, an artificial intelligence research and development company under OpenAI, on March 31, 2018.

Of the investments up to 40 billion US dollars, 10 billion US dollars will be syndicated with external investors, so SoftBank Group's actual investments are up to 30 billion US dollars (4.4856 trillion yen), with 10 billion US dollars expected to be completed in mid-April 2025 and the maximum US dollars of 30 billion US dollars in December 2025. Additionally, SBG's traditional financial policy regarding LTV (Loan to Value: calculated based on adjusted net interest-bearing debt ÷ shareholding value) and liquidity on hand remain unchanged.

SBG has invested a total of USD 2.2 billion in OpenAI from SoftBank Vision Fund 2 since September 2024. On January 21, 2025, together with OpenAI, they announced the "Stargate Project," which will build AI infrastructure in the United States.

The additional investment will be to support OpenAI's further growth in line with the Stargate project, and to incorporate the fruits of that growth into SBG's NAV (Net Asset Value: Stockholding - calculated as adjusted net interest-bearing debt).
